intro: Crepis mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in grassy habitats. It is a perennial herb that often forms dense cushions or mats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
